types.name: Address
types.description: Addresses are associated with Orders. They can either be shipping or billing addresses.

fields.name: city
fields.description: Use this to keep the city/town name.

fields.name: company
fields.description: Use this to keep an optional company name for addresses.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Use this to keep the country name.

fields.name: line1
fields.description: Use this to keep the first line of the address.

fields.name: line2
fields.description: Use this to keep the apartment, door number, etc.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Use this to keep the name of the recipient.

fields.name: postalCode
fields.description: Use this to keep the post/postal/zip code.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Use this to keep the state/county name.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Cart
types.description: Carts are the core concept of CartQL. Bring your own PIM and use CartQL to calculate your Cart and Checkout.

fields.name: abandoned
fields.description: A simple helper method to check if the cart hasn't been updated in the last 2 hours.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Custom key/value attributes array for the cart.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time the cart was created.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The current currency details of the cart.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer for the cart

fields.name: grandTotal
fields.description: The grand total for all items, including shipping, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A custom unique identifer for the cart provided by you.

fields.name: isEmpty
fields.description: A simple helper method to check if the cart is empty.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The items currently in the cart.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Custom meta object for the cart

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Any notes related to the cart/checkout

fields.name: shippingTotal
fields.description: The cart total for all items with type SHIPPING, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details.

fields.name: subTotal
fields.description: Sum of all SKU items, excluding discounts, taxes, shipping, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details

fields.name: taxTotal
fields.description: The cart total for all items with type TAX, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details.

fields.name: totalItems
fields.description: The number of total items in the cart

fields.name: totalUniqueItems
fields.description: The number of total unique items in the cart.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time the cart was updated.

types.name: CartItem
types.description: A Cart Item is used to store data on the items inside the Cart. There are no strict rules about what you use the named fields for.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Custom key/value attributes array for the item.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time the item was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description for the item.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A custom unique identifer for the item provided by you.

fields.name: images
fields.description: Array of image URLs for the item.

fields.name: lineTotal
fields.description: Line total (quantity * unit price).

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Custom metadata for the item.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name for the item.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Quantity for the item.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of cart item this is.

fields.name: unitTotal
fields.description: Unit total for the individual item.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time the item was updated.

types.name: CartItemType
types.description: Use these enums to group cart items. Cart totals will reflect these enums.

types.name: Currency
types.description: Cart and Cart Items use the currency object to format their unit/line totals.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The currency code, e.g. USD, GBP, EUR

fields.name: decimalDigits
fields.description: The decimal places for the currency

fields.name: decimalSeparator
fields.description: The decimal separator, e.g. '.'

fields.name: symbol
fields.description: The currency smybol, e.g. $, £, €

fields.name: thousandsSeparator
fields.description: The thousand separator, e.g. ',', '.'

types.name: CustomCartAttribute
types.description: Custom Cart Attributes are used for any type of custom data you want to store on a Cart. These are transferred to Orders when you checkout.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the Cart you wish to delete.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the Cart you wish to empty.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Money
types.description: The Money type is used when describing the Cart and Cart Item unit/line totals.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The raw amount in cents/pence

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The current currency details of the money amount

fields.name: formatted
fields.description: The formatted amount with the cart currency.

fields.name: addItem
fields.description: Use this to add items to the cart. If the item already exists, the provided input will be merged and quantity will be increased.

fields.name: checkout
fields.description: Use this to convert a cart to an unpaid order.

fields.name: decrementItemQuantity
fields.description: Use this to decrease the item quantity of the provided item ID. If the item doesn't exist, it'll throw an error.

fields.name: deleteCart
fields.description: Use this to delete a cart. If the cart doesn't exist, it'll throw an error.

fields.name: emptyCart
fields.description: Use this to empty the cart. If the cart doesn't exist, it'll throw an error.

fields.name: incrementItemQuantity
fields.description: Use this to increase the item quantity of the provided item ID. If the item doesn't exist, it'll throw an error.

fields.name: removeItem
fields.description: Use this to remove any items from the cart. If it doesn't exist, it'll throw an error.

fields.name: setItems
fields.description: Use this to set all the items at once in the cart. This will override any existing items.

fields.name: updateCart
fields.description: Use this to update the cart currency or metadata. If the cart doesn't exist, it'll throw an error.

fields.name: updateItem
fields.description: Use this to update any existing items in the cart. If the item doesn't exist, it'll return an error.

types.name: Order
types.description: Orders are immutable. Once created, you can't change them. The status will automatically reflect the current payment status.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: The custom attributes set at checkout

fields.name: billing
fields.description: The orders billing address.

fields.name: cartId
fields.description: The ID of the cart you want to "checkout".

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time the order was created.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email of the recipient. Can be used later for cart recovery emails.

fields.name: grandTotal
fields.description: The grand total for all items, including shipping, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The order items that were in the cart.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The metadata set at checkout

fields.name: notes
fields.description: The notes set at checkout.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: The orders shipping address.

fields.name: shippingTotal
fields.description: The total for all items with type SHIPPING, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current order status. This will reflect the current payment status. The first stage is 'unpaid'.

fields.name: subTotal
fields.description: Sum of all SKU items, excluding discounts, taxes, shipping, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details

fields.name: taxTotal
fields.description: The total for all items with type TAX, including the raw/formatted amounts and currency details.

fields.name: totalItems
fields.description: The total item count.

fields.name: totalUniqueItems
fields.description: The total unique item count.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time the order status was updated.

types.name: OrderItem
types.description:
Orders contain items that were converted from the Cart at 'checkout'.

Order items are identical to the CartItem type.

fields.name: cart
fields.description: Use this to get a cart by a custom ID. If a cart doesn't exist with this ID, it will be created for you.

inputFields.name: cartId
inputFields.description: The ID of the Cart in which the CartItem belongs to.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the CartItem you wish to remove.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

inputFields.name: by
inputFields.description: The amount (as Int) you wish to increment the Cart item quantity by.

inputFields.name: cartId
inputFields.description: The ID of the Cart in which the CartItem belongs to.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the CartItem you wish to update.

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
